elements.name: question2
elements.title: Note down what the decisions you have ticked have in common:
elements.correctAnswer: They are all either on the far left or the far right politically, and they entail major changes.

elements.name: question3
elements.title: Using the terms compromise, balance of interests and political center, explain why decisions made by our concordance government are usually accepted by the people and parliament, even if the left and right parties are not (entirely) satisfied with them:
elements.correctAnswer: Several parties are represented in a concordance government, which is why a compromise or balance of interests must always be sought when making decisions. Because both left-wing and right-wing parties are represented in our government alongside a centrist party, the compromise therefore lies in the political center.
